globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-use-parent-value
globalAttributes.description: Uses the parent element as the sticky selector, this is a project specific option that is unrelated to stickybits. When `true` then `this.element.parentElement` will be used as selector.

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-offset-value
globalAttributes.description: By default, an element will have a 0px sticky layout top offset. This means that the element will stick flush to the top of the viewport. This will control the offset of stick.

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-breakpoint-value
globalAttributes.description: The screen max-width viewport breakpoint the sticky element should operate. If the screen width is is less than the viewport defined here then the sticky will either disconnect or not initialize.

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-no-styles-value
globalAttributes.description: Apply the sticky without inline styles except for `position: sticky` or `position: fixed;`

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-bottom-value
globalAttributes.description: Stick elements stick to the bottom. The default is to stick to the top.

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-bounding-value
globalAttributes.description: Disabled use of `offsetTop`. This feature is optimal when dealing with things like CSS calc which can throw off `offsetTop` calculations. Read more about this functionality [here](https://muffinman.io/blog/javascript-get-element-offset/)

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-use-fixed-value
globalAttributes.description: Disabled the use of `position: sticky` and instead uses `position: fixed`

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-scroll-element-value
globalAttributes.description: Stickies will use `window` as scroll element. You can define a different scroll element here by providing the selector to use besides `window`.

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-parent-class
globalAttributes.description: Apply a custom CSS to the parent element

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-sticky-class
globalAttributes.description: Apply a custom CSS to the sticky element

globalAttributes.name: data-sticky-stuck-class
globalAttributes.description: Apply a custom CSS to the stuck element
